themes.description: Core concepts of business agility including VUCA environment drivers, values, principles, and the case for change
learning_outcomes: Illustrate the core foundational concepts of Business Agility in relevant business contexts
Clarify values and principles and why they are important enablers of building organizational intelligence
Describe the role of values and principles in cultivating new ways of thinking and working
Convey that critical success factors include trust, safety, collaboration, cohesion, autonomy, mastery and purpose as well as new levels of individual accountability and responsibility
Grasp why and how to shift focus from outputs to outcomes by eliminating waste, doing less and accelerating innovation
Communicate why creating disruptive outcomes in today's volatile economy requires real-time knowledge generation as well as radical new ways of thinking and working

themes.description: Creating compelling visions, clarity of purpose, and understanding customers and stakeholders
learning_outcomes: Communicate the importance of aligning organizations around a crisp, believable, compelling and inspiring vision
Experience methods for creating such visions and clear purposes
Envision the future state of business agility, then learn ways to look backwards from that future to craft a compelling path
Gain an understanding of why and how to use this activity with their teams
Explain the values, principles, tools and techniques needed to develop empathy and improve awareness of customer and stakeholder context
Apply tools such as persona maps, customer journey maps, empathy maps, customer value propositions, business model canvas

themes.description: Developing growth mindset, recognizing blind spots, understanding complexity, and managing polarities
learning_outcomes: Describe the attributes of a growth mindset in contrast to the limitations of a fixed mindset in the Business Agility context
Introduce the concept of reframing failure as an opportunity to learn
Recognize that blind spots and mental biases exist and understand the role that our mental models play
Apply the skills needed to examine mental models and how individuals make meaning
Provide an overview of the field of complex adaptive systems and complexity theory
Provide practical awareness of relevant management models (systems dynamics, Complex Adaptive Systems, Cynefin, Theory of Constraints)
Distinguish polarities (dilemmas, paradigms and paradoxes) from traditional problems
Learn to see the relationship between the poles with the goal of optimizing the wins and minimizing the losses

themes.description: High-performance questions, making value visible, experimentation, and change management
learning_outcomes: Define high-performance questions, give examples of the power they have towards enhancing organizational outcomes
Discuss techniques for using them as often as possible in day-to-day conversations
Emphasize that value is only delivered through the completion of a new or improved functional slice of work that is implemented and delivered to a customer for use
Understand why and how to identify small, discrete opportunities, then craft hypotheses in order to frame relevant experiments
Understand why and how rapid experimentation accelerates learning and business agility
Experience the complex dynamics involved when creating sustainable change and the reason why individuals and organizations deeply resist it
Understand lean change practices and why co-creating change is essential
Describe and discuss change frameworks, polarity management frameworks and what makes them effective

themes.description: Lean systems thinking, lean startup, design thinking, kanban, and iterative frameworks
learning_outcomes: Learn why a lack of end-to-end systems thinking and a failure to focus on value throughout the organization leads to waste and ineffective outcomes
Understand how a Lean Systems Approach enables business agility by focusing on strategic goals, measuring value, and eliminating waste
Introduce concepts and applications of the Build - Measure - Learn framework for dealing with uncertainty
Learn about minimal viable product, thin slices and benefits of failing fast to succeed sooner
Apply the concepts of design thinking and focus on new ways of thinking about elements of a product or solution that evolve around the customer
Provide an understanding of the key values and practices of kanban, along with ideas on why and how to apply these values
Understand and use iterative frameworks and how they accelerate learning and discovery

themes.description: Creating optimal environments, continuous learning, reinvention, and measures of success
learning_outcomes: Analyze what a business agility environment and learning ecosystem looks like and why it is vital in a VUCA world
Devise strategies to create an environment that enables value creation, rapid decision making and optimized execution
Reflect on and synthesize key learnings in the unique context of each participant's experience, work structures and challenges
Extend Business Agility mastery and learning beyond the course
Identify and explain ways in which the participants can make the ongoing application of business agility part of the habitual way of working
Communicate the importance of learning agility and how empirical data and relevant, actionable metrics support real learning
Understand limitations of lagging indicators and excessive metrics that do not drive the right behaviors
